snippet: The Ironman swim, part of a triathlon scheduled for Saturday, starts about 15 miles south of the site of the discharge in Sleepy Hollow, N.Y.
abstract: Partly treated sewage gushing into the Hudson River threatens the Ironman swim, part of a triathlon scheduled for the weekend; Westchester County approved what officials are calling a 'controlled discharge' of millions of gallons of sewage while repairs are made to a sewer line in Tarrytown; residents are being warned to avoid direct contact with the water.
lead_paragraph: The Ironman swim, part of a triathlon scheduled for Saturday, starts about 15 miles south of the site of the discharge in Sleepy Hollow, N.Y.

headline.seo: Sewage Spill in Hudson Threatens Ironman Swim
headline.main: Raw Sewage Threatening Hudson River Race
